meanings.def: a person or an animal that travels with you or spends a lot of time with you
examples: Geoff was my companion on the journey.
(figurative) Fear was the hostages' constant companion.

meanings.def: a person who shares your experiences, especially when these are particularly pleasant or unpleasant
examples: She was a charming dinner companion.
His younger brother is not much of a companion for him.
They're drinking companions (= they go out drinking together).
He was an entertaining dinner companion.

meanings.def: a person, usually a woman, employed to live with and help somebody, especially somebody old or ill
examples: She lived in the house as a companion to our grandmother.

meanings.def: one of a pair of things that go together or can be used together
examples: A companion volume is soon to be published.

meanings.def: used in book titles to describe a book giving useful facts and information on a particular subject
